relationships.description: Email correspondence discussing employment and political matters
Ruemmle states she is not leaving Latham
Quinn offered Ruemmle a signing bonus

transactions: $2 million signing bonus offered by Quinn

emotional_indicators: confidence in decision to stay at current firm
analysis.purpose: To inform J about a job offer received and declined, and to respond to a political question
analysis.significance: Shows high-value legal recruitment activity and political discussion

notable_quotes: Quinn offered a $2 mm signing bonus today. I said not leaving Latham.
do you think trump has the power to declare a national emergency to build the wall?
red_flags: High-value recruitment offer ($2 million signing bonus)

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion present

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed or evidenced

public_knowledge.context: Private email exchange about personal employment decision and political question

analysis.summary: Kathy Ruemmle emails J to report that Quinn offered her a $2 million signing bonus but she declined, stating she's not leaving Latham, while also responding to J's question about whether Trump has power to declare a national emergency for border wall construction.
